description: Sven Halek decides to suppress key evidence of Congress exclusion lists, crafting calming public messaging and urging Congress leaders to promise rapid reforms. He mediates covertly with activists to hold off mass anger.

Congress leaders publicly pledge reforms at town hall meetings, echoing Sven's calming narratives. Outward stability returns, but quiet rumors circulate about continued exclusion practices under new names.
Leaked documents reveal Congress is maintaining 'ghost lists' to restrict access to resources and civic participation, triggering public outrage and comparisons to the BCI era.
Oksana Lintz publishes corroborating evidence, exposing Congress as repeating past abuses of exclusion. Crowds gather outside Congress offices, demanding transparency and accountability.

Amid mass protests and emergency hearings, Congress leaders admit to exclusion practices and vow genuine reform. Calls for a full purge of exclusion records intensify citywide debate about ending systemic surveillance.
